name: Pliable, LLC Covid-19 Vaccine Site
address: THEOREM CANNABIS | 6323 NE Bothell Way, Kenmore WA, 98028
vaccines: Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine, Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine
info:
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
******J.O.I.N.T.S...F.O.R...J.A.B.S******must be 21 years old+ ******
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

ONE (1) complimentary joint may be provided to a customer who receives a first or second COVID-19 vaccine dose at the event *by and at the determination of Theorem Cannabis* 
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

FOR INFORMATION ON JOINTS FOR JABS: https://lcb.wa.gov/pressreleases/lcb-allows-joints-for-jabs-promotions

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We warmly welcome you to Pliable’s mobile COVID-19 vaccination clinic hosted at Theorem Cannabis in Kenmore,WA on Wednesday June 23rd! 
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

This vaccination event is administering the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine (1st or 2nd doses!) and also offering Johnson&Johnson  

Pfizer is a two-dose vaccination series.
If you have had your 1st dose, please bring your CDC vaccination card with you to your 2nd-dose appointment.
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Pliable LLC is a nurse practitioner-led organization for mindfully-driven healthcare. In alignment with Washington State Department of Health’s (DOH) equitable COVID-19 vaccine distribution strategies, our goal is to equitably and compassionately serve those communities disproportionately impacted by COVID-19 and help fill in vaccine access gaps. 
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Please read the CDC and WA DOH information regarding COVID-19 Vaccinations and have your questions answered BEFORE REGISTERING. Resources can be found at: https://www.doh.wa.gov/Emergencies/COVID19/Vaccine https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/pfizer/pfizer-bioNTech-faqs.html 
https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/janssen/index.html
.
The Fact Sheet for Pfizer vaccination can be found at: https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download 

The Fact Sheet for Johnson and Johnson vaccination can be found at: 
https://www.fda.gov/media/146305/download

For resources on side effects and post vaccination expectations: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/expect/after.html
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

By proceeding and scheduling online you are consenting to the following terms below as the patient or surrogate decision maker for the patient, including minors. 
• I certify that I am 21 years or older
• I understand it is not possible to predict all possible side effects or complications associated with receiving the Pfizer COVID-19 or Johnson&Johnson vaccine. 
• I understand the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has authorized the emergency use of this vaccine, which is not an FDA approved vaccine in this patient population. I understand the nature, alternatives, benefits and risks of vaccination, to the extent they are known at this time. 
• I am encouraged to sign up with v-safe: https://vsafe.cdc.gov/ 
• I acknowledge that I have been advised to remain near the vaccination location for observation for 15 minutes after administration, 30 mins if I have a prior history of allergic reactions to vaccines. 
• I give my consent to Pliable LLC, including licensed employees, volunteers, and partners, to administer the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine OR Johnson&Johnson COVID-19 vaccine as described above. Neither these entities or our host facilities/business can be held liable for adverse outcomes
• PREP Act Authorization for CDC COVID-19 Vaccination Program 
Governor Jay Inslee’s Proclamation by the Governor 20-05, issued on February 29, 2020 and subsequently amended, is a Declaration of Emergency. Covered Persons include, among others, any person authorized in accordance with the public health and medical emergency response of the Authority Having Jurisdiction to prescribe, administer, deliver, distribute or dispense the Covered Countermeasures, program planners, and their officials, agents, employees, contractors and volunteers, following a Declaration of Emergency.
https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-2020-03-17/pdf/2020-05484.pdf
• I authorize and understand Pliable LLC may be required to or may voluntarily disclose my vaccine-related health information to my insurance plan, state or federal registries, and/or other public health authorities, for purposes of payment or health care operations. 
• I understand that I am not creating a patient relationship with Pliable LLC by participating in vaccination. I understand Pliable LLC is not acting as my medical provider. Vaccination does not replace treatment by my medical provider. I agree I will seek medical advice, care and treatment from a medical provider if I have questions or concerns, or if I experience side effects. 
• I have been provided expectations for the day of my vaccination.
• I acknowledge that I have read the vaccine Fact Sheet and agree to these terms and conditions. 
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

On the day of your appointment: 
• Registration and attestation serves as consent.  NO MINORS allowed.
• Vaccination is available regardless of your citizenship or immigration status. 
• If you have insurance, please include this information during your online registration. Insurance is NOT required, you will not be billed, the vaccination is FREE TO ALL. Insurance will cover administrative costs if available. 
• Wear a short-sleeved shirt or clothing that allows access to your upper arm.  • Masks are required at all times at the clinic. If you do not have a mask one will be provided to you. 
• Please arrive no earlier than 10 minutes prior to your scheduled appointment time. Appointment cannot be guaranteed if you arrive late. • Do not visit the site if you are experiencing symptoms of COVID-19 on the day of your appointment. 
• If you have a history of serious allergic reactions (anaphylaxis) and are prescribed an epinephrine auto injector (Epipen, etc) please bring this to your vaccination appointment and notify clinical staff. 
 ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

HAPPY VACCINATION DAY!

www.bepliable.com
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Care-A-Van Welcome Back Tacoma
vaccines: Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine, Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine, Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine
info:
This is a multiple vaccine type clinic offering J&J as a single dose, Moderna as 1st or 2nd dose, and Pfizer as 1st or 2nd dose. Please indicate which vaccine you are seeking and if this is a 1st or 2nd dose. Please note: Johnson & Johnson and Moderna vaccine can only be administered to individuals 18 years of age or older according CDC requirements. Pfizer can be administered to youth ages 12 to 17 if accompanied by an adult who can sign a parental consent form.
**************************************************************************************
This vaccine clinic is located at Wright Park being held in collaboration with Metro Parks Tacoma the Governor’s Office, the “Washington Ready” campaign, WA Department of Health and Bird's Eye Medical. This campaign is a statewide celebration of the end to current COVID-19 restrictions and provides an opportunity for Washingtonians to celebrate the end of this chapter.  
 
For details and updates, including special announcements on the “Welcome Back, Tacoma!” event, visit cityoftacoma.org/welcomeback.

*******************************************************************************
Please let us know if you or someone you are accompanying needs assistance of any kind.  **You should also plan your visit around waiting for 15 minutes in the observation area so we can monitor for any unlikely adverse reactions to the vaccine.** Certain people with pre-identified conditions or past anaphylaxis events may be asked to wait for 30 minutes of observation.

Free language translation services are provided. Video ASL translation is also provided.
*****************************************************************************
If this is your 2nd dose please bring your vaccination card from your 1st dose. If you do not have your card you may register with and confirm proof of vaccination at https://wa.myir.net/                      
 Please do not come if you are feeling ill. Please arrive as close as possible to your scheduled time to prevent crowding that will impede appropriate social distancing. - It is best to wear clothes that will allow for access to your upper arm, just below the shoulder.
****************************************************************************
Participants are asked to enjoy this celebration responsibly by following current CDC masking requirements while in attendance.
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Yakima County Health District COVID Vaccination Site
info:
***1ST & 2nd DOSE PFIZER VACCINATIONS!!!!*** The vaccination clinic will take place at El Porton Mexican Restaurant . This clinic will be outside. Masks are required. Please wear clothing which allows access to your shoulder. All individuals 12 and over are eligible to get vaccinated. Those under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian or must get parental consent via video/phone call or paper format.
 
Informacion Adicional: ***VACUNAS DE PRIMERA Y SEGUNDA DOSIS PFIZER!!!*** La clínica de vacunación se ubicará en El Porton Mexican Restaurant. Se requieren máscaras. Por favor, use ropa que permita acceso a su brazo. Todas las personas mayores de 12 años son elegibles para vacunarse. Los menores de 18 años deben estar acompañados por un padre/tutor o deben obtener el consentimiento de los padres por video/llamada telefónica o en papel.
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Olympic Pharmacy and Healthcare Services - COVID Vaccine Venue
address: 4700 Point Fosdick Drive, Suite 120, Gig Harbor WA, 98335
info:
**THIS CLINIC IS FOR JANSSEN (JOHNSON&JOHNSON) VACCINATIONS ONLY**
You must be 18 years of age or older.

Please bring your State ID, and if you have insurance, please bring your insurance card or Medicare B card (red, white and blue card).

Please do not come to the clinic if you are not feeling well.

Please wear loose sleeved, short sleeved or sleeveless shirt.

Please arrive as close as possible to your scheduled time to prevent crowding that will impede appropriate social distancing.

Please be prepared to wait 15-30 minutes after vaccination for observation of adverse reactions.
